doc.after: According to Tito, the national composition of the Partisan army in May 1944 was 44% Serb, 30% Croat, 10% Slovene, 5% Montenegrin, 2.5% Macedonian, and 2.5% Bosnian Muslim.[48] Italians and Hungarians were also in the army. 20.000 Italian fighters were in Partisan Battalion Pino Budicin, Division Garibaldi and Division Italia later.[49] According to the Encyclopedia of the Holocaust of the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum,
